hook.text: The League of Nations was built to prevent another world war. Twenty years later, it watched one happen.

buildup.text: Woodrow Wilson championed the League, but the US Senate refused to join â€” gutting it from the start.

discovery.text: Without the US and without enforcement power, the League couldn't stop Japan, Italy, or Germany from conquering.

twist.text: The League proved that an agreement without enforcement is just a wish written on expensive paper.

climax.text: International agreements need participation from the key players and consequences for violations.

punchline.text: A deal without teeth is just a conversation everyone agreed to forget.
